result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenny Darrelle Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $579.00 due at $100 per month beginning 08-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

supervisions.notes:
Payment of $100 fine + court costs = $473.50 due at $100 per month beginning 08-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
No DNA surcharge on Count 2.

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Defendant Kenny Darrelle Anderson in court.  Attorney robert James mraz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney William Reabe in court for Kenny Darrelle Anderson. 
Court calls case. 
Atty Reabe heard - case has been resolved.
Atty Reabe provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Reabe agrees.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Atty Reabe satisfied.
Court reviews prior conviction.
Deft agrees.
ADA agrees.
Atty Reabe agrees.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Counts 1 and 2.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Reabe heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 1:
Payment of $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $579.00 due at $100 per month beginning 08-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 06-27-2022.
Court imposes on Count 2:
Payment of $100 fine + costs only = $473.50 due at $100 per month beginning 08-01-2022 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
Appeal rights.
10:30 AM
Dean Appt - Atty Reabe, repayment at $125/week beginning 06-01-2022.

Court calls case.

Deft understands.

Deft states he does not intend to have an atty.

If deft chooses to waive atty - must bring completed form to next hearing.

Deft heard.
Court imposes $1000 signature bond w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, mo possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license.
